913046388:
[

Finance Manager

Company Name CPR Pharma Services Pty Ltd Company Location 28 Dalgleish St, Adelaide, SA 5031, AU

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

An opportunity has arisen for a CA Qualified Finance Manager to join our corporate team. Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, you will be responsible for providing accounting expertise and supporting the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) to assist manage the company finances.


The Role

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Managing all day to day financial activities utilising MYOB including accounts payable and receivable, payroll, cash processing, time accounting, BAS returns etc. in addition to all month end routines.
  • Management Reporting to CFO and budget holders on the financial performance of the company both formally on a monthly basis and on an ad-hoc basis.
  • Cash forecasting, monitoring and reporting to the CFO and CEO.
  • Supporting the CFO in the production of the annual budget and ongoing re-forecasts.
  • Liaising with external bodies including external tax accountants, external auditors, bankers and insurance brokers.
  • System improvements as directed by the CFO and CEO
  • Development and review of finance policies and procedures.
  • Human Resource Management of finance team.


About you

  • CA/CPA qualified with a minimum of 5 years experience in a leading accounting role as a Financial Controller or Finance Manager.
  • Expert user of computerised accounting systems (MYOB experience preferable).
  • Experience of system/process improvement (system implementation experience preferable).
  • Demonstrated people management experience.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Intermediate to advanced MS Office skills.
  • A proven track record in managing deadlines and prioritising work commitments.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills to liaise with managers and staff at all levels of the organisation and with clients and visitors alike.
  • The ability to work autonomously in a confidential environment.
  • The ability to exercise a high degree of initiative and discretion while maintaining an important and effective link to all areas of the organisation.
  • Pharmaceutical industry experience (preferable)


To Apply

  • Please submit your CV along with a cover letter outlining your skills and experience that make you suitable for this role, please submit as one Microsoft Word document.

  • As we receive a high volume of applications for our vacancies, we will only contact you directly, should you be successful through to the next stage of our recruitment process.

  • For further information about CPR Pharma Services, please visit our website at http://www.cprservices.com.au


CPR Pharma Services is an equal opportunity employer

Company Name HOBAN Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 27 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

A large global consulting firm with offices located around Australia in Melbourne, Sydney and Perth are looking to appoint an Executive Team Assistant due to promotion in their Melbourne CBD Office. Our client assists a variety of companies on a global scale with a combination of deep industry knowledge and expert perspectives from other industries on the challenges they have, offering fresh ideas and breakthrough business insights.

This vibrant work place have been an Employer of Choice for the last 5 years, which makes going to work and having work life balance a top priority!! We are looking for an experienced and dynamic Team Executive Assistant with a passion and flair for calendar and event management.

Role

Reporting to the Managing Director and supporting a small team of 4 partners, your role will include but not limited to
  • Extensive diary/calendar management
  • Scheduling internal and external meetings for the team
  • Stakeholder engagement across a variety of clients
  • Organising events and national conferences
  • Booking domestic and international travel and organising visas if required
In addition to the above, you will be liaising directly with external stakeholders and EA's, setting up training and meeting rooms whilst assisting with all ad hoc administration.

To be successful you will have at least three years’ experience in an administrative support capacity as a team assistant, preferably within a fast paced environment. Candidates with a background in a sales support/professional services or financial services will be highly regarded.

You will have solid communication skills, strong MS Office knowledge, the ability to multi-task and manage conflicting priorities and use your intuition.

In return for your support to the wider business you will be rewarded with an annual bonus of 8% if you are meeting expectations. You will have the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment with an amazing culture that supports its staff members and acknowledges hard work with support and training.

If you are looking for your next career move click on apply now. If you have any questions please contact Zoe Bailey on 9203 4900.

*\xa0A mix of strategic and operational skills, a wide variety of work\xa0

The successful person\xa0will uplift the senior HR business partner capability to provide high quality support to the Executive Team and\xa0a number of new strategic people priorities. 911996868:
[

Media Sales Executive

Company Name Southern Cross Austereo Company Location Griffith, AU

New Posted Date Posted 24 hours ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description



Southern Cross Austereo is all about delivering absolutely engaging entertainment solutions across an unrivalled portfolio of multimedia brands with the biggest shows, best talent and most exciting events across Australia. We engage staff who are the best in the business and want to work for a supportive, exciting and dynamic company with a culture of high performance. We look far and wide to employ a diverse workforce – we all bring something a little bit different – and in return we give you everything you need to bring your best self to work.

As our next Media Sales Executive you will help us grow by seeking out & capturing new business. As a commercially minded sales executive your ability to build and foster strong relationships with key stakeholders and influence buy-in will ensure that you leverage all possible revenue opportunities to meet your monthly targets.

We are looking for the newest member of the SCA Crew who has;
  • Experience in business solutions selling – preferably in the Media or Entertainment industries
  • The ability to deal confidently and efficiently with people at all levels
  • The ability to create compelling sales pitches for our iconic brands
  • First class, persuasive negotiation skills
  • A positive attitude and the ability to remain calm in an often fast paced, dynamic environment

    • Most of all, SCA is a values driven organisation- If you genuinely live and breathe our values, you’ll be a perfect fit for SCA. We collaborate, take initiative, maximise creativity, have courage and act with integrity.

    Still not convinced?
    The benefits of working for us are countless – to name a few we have a focus on work-life balance, health insurance discounts, workplace banking programs, concert tickets, footy tickets, special client discounts throughout the year, rooftop gigs, social gatherings – the list goes on!

    Keen? Apply now by submitting your resume and cover letter.

    WHY US?

    As one of Australia's most innovative and exciting entertainment-based media companies, working for Southern Cross Austereo is far more than a job – it’s an opportunity to be associated with one of the world’s leaders in media entertainment. Our radio networks are committed to delivering the country’s best entertainment, music, sport, comedy and big events to Australians whilst our digital division is leading the way in thought leadership and innovation. We also have affiliation arrangements with all of the metropolitan commercial television networks which means SCA’s television services cover most of regional Australia. The combination of our TV, Radio and digital assets can reach 95% of Australians, engaging over 10 million people per week, making us a truly integrated media company.

    Employing approximately 2,500 staff nationally, SCA is an exciting, vibrant, energetic and progressive company. Our values are the standards which our people share that guide our day-to-day decisions, shape or individual and collective behaviour and make us who we are today.

    The opportunities to grow your career is endless when you’re working for one of Australia’s leading media companies. We provide all staff with ongoing support and guidance to develop your skills, grow your media career and reach your full potential.

    EQUAL OPPORTUNITY

    We are committed to advancing equal employment opportunities for our staff and to diversify and develop our workforce. Furthermore, we aim to recognise the value of attracting and retaining employees with different backgrounds, experience, knowledge and abilities. We also aim to ensure diversity contributes to our business success and benefits individuals, teams, clients and the community.

    Seniority Level

    Associate

    Industry

    • Broadcast Media

    Employment Type

CREATE YOUR OWN PATH

As an energetic customer focussed individual, you will join our Technology Workplace team at the Macquarie Melbourne office. As well as general Tech Assist and an information point, the walk-up Tech Assist Desk will be used to provide local technology training and a hub to provide loan equipment, a repair service, and promotion of Technology products.

As a first point of contact for all staff with a query around Technology within Macquarie, you will have an immediate impact on the service to the business and be the face of technology. It is essential that you have excellent communication skills, are able to think on your feet, have a flexible and easy-going manner, as well as the ability to multi-task and prioritise and work effectively with minimal supervision.

  • previous experience in a Help Desk/Desktop Support role.

The Corporate Operations Group (COG) brings together specialist support services including workplace, human resources, market operations and technology. COG's purpose is to drive operational excellence through business-aligned services with a focus on quality, cost and risk. COG comprises the following divisions: Business Improvement and Strategy, Business Services, Human Resources, Market Operations, and Technology.

Regional Application Support Manager

Company Name The Trade Desk Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 20 minutes ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

We are looking to hire a Sydney-based Regional Application Support Manager\xa0who will work in collaboration with our Biz Teams to ensure top notch Application Support. We’re looking for someone who is enthusiastic about new technology, has not only the existing technical skills to be successful but also the acumen to learn even more; you’ll never run out of things to learn here. You’re comfortable being a mediator between account and technology teams, helping both reach solutions on high-priority technical issues. There is plenty of room for advancement in this role within the department or otherwise within our company.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:
  • Provide oversight, guidance and mentorship to members of the Global Support Team.
  • Oversee and maintain the company’s ticketing case system; answer, troubleshoot and resolve various technical issues related to our trading platform.
  • Take initiative on tickets that can be completed without Development Team assistance.
  • Multi-task, troubleshoot and resolve various technical issues related to the Trade Desk's Trading Platform Application.
  • Act as a primary conduit/catalyst between the Support Team and other TTD Teams.
  • Responsible for owning incidents, including collaborating and escalating to Engineering, Product, Integrations and Business Intelligence.
  • Act as Support Team Leader in the absence of the Global Support Director’s.
  • Assess team progression and identify needs of team members.
  • Manage responsibility for individual members’ development and performance.
  • Oversee issue escalation tracking and response management.
  • Ensure platform incidents and tools are handled with adherence to SLAs.
  • Executing, Manipulate Stored Procedures and Queries in SQL.
  • Ad Tag, Pixel Tags and Discrepancy troubleshooting.
  • QA Testing and Validation.
  • Contribute to the company and Support Team’s Knowledge Base.
  • Assist with screening and hiring permanent support team members for the Support Organization.
  • Coordinate in-depth training on Support-related tools and processes.
  • Light on-call/after-hours support.
WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE:
  • Bachelor’s Degree from a four-year university or relevant substitute experience
  • 4 – 6 years relevant work experience in Technical and/or Application Support

Desired Skills and Experience

  • Outstanding troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities, along with an ability to collaborate cross-functionally in a fast-paced and growing environment
  • Mid-level to advanced experience with Programming languages (HTML, Java, JavaScript ,Vast .XML) is a plus
  • Experience handling complex datasets, identifying trends within the data, and performing comparisons between multiple data sources.
  • Mid-level to advanced experience with databases, SQL, API's - Able to create queries to retrieve records, aggregate data from a variety of data sources, and an understanding of the underlying data structures.
  • Mid-level to advanced knowledge of Excel and MS Office, including pivot tables, chart-making, and manipulation of large data sets is a plus

\xa0This position does not have review or termination authority.

The Trade Desk does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firm recruiters. Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired; such resumes will be deemed the sole property of The Trade Desk. The Trade Desk is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

911450751:
[

Compliance Analyst

Company Name Chubb Company Location Sydney

New Posted Date Posted 14 hours ago Number of views 16 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Main Purpose:


The Compliance Analyst provides specialist compliance support, advice and ongoing maintenance and development of the Chubb risk and compliance framework for Australia and New Zealand, by completing monitoring and assurance activities to ensure compliance in accordance with regulatory, industry, legal and company standards and requirements. They will also assist with and manage compliance assurance reviews, incident/breach investigation and remediation. They may also assist the wider Risk & Compliance team with other compliance related activities when required.


Responsibilities:

  • Assist in the completion and coordination of Compliance Assurance Reviews as outlined by the Compliance Manager.
  • Complete due diligence reviews on third parties and contribute to the third party risk assessment, on-boarding and management process.
  • Assist with the sanctions program including keeping up to date with relevant sanctions requirements.
  • Participate in the development, implementation and monitoring of the Compliance program including as it relates to the Combined Division.
  • Completion of the monthly compliance monitoring as outlined in the Compliance Calendar. This includes but is not limited to: monitoring of calls and correspondence with customers, claims file reviews, Remediation Action Plan (RAP) file reviews and quality assurance reviews.
  • Identify, investigate and manage incidents and breaches as outlined by the Compliance Manager and work with the business and functions to assist in improved processes and control strengthening.
  • Identify any possible breaches of relevant legislation, regulations and obligations by the business.
  • Record and analyse reported Compliance incidents and breaches.
  • Conduct website reviews to ensure compliance with regulations and legislation in regards to marketing and selling Chubb products.
  • Support the Compliance Manager in the provision of compliance training and guidance documents to employees.
  • Maintain effective relationships with stakeholders and maintain and develop knowledge of business and compliance matters.
  • Assist the Compliance Manager to compile and report on Compliance activities to the Enterprise Risk Committee.
  • Work with other Risk and Compliance team members in the development and maintenance of a proactive compliance culture within Chubb.

Other periodical cross-team activities, which may include:

  • Assisting with the investigation, analysis and preparation of determinations for the Australian and New Zealand Internal Disputes Resolution team.
  • Assisting with the preparation of the External Disputes Resolution responses to the Financial Ombudsman Service Australia and Financial Services Complaints Limited.
  • Assisting the Disputes team liaise with the business units to coordinate and deliver effective handling of disputes.
  • Adhering to timeframes contained within the General Insurance Code of Practice and New Zealand Fair Insurance Code.
  • Assist with other compliance matters on request.


Desired Skills and Experience

Knowledge & Skills:
  • Knowledge of Financial Services regulatory compliance.
  • Experience in financial services industry.
  • Experience in risk and compliance role preferred, but quality assurance/monitoring/business process and audit roles also considered.
  • Analytical skills.
  • Tertiary qualification in commerce, accounting, business or law desirable.
  • Complaint handling experience.
  • Ability to manage customer and stakeholder expectations;
  • Good recording keeping.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Excellent attention to detail.
  • Ability to multitask and adhere to deadlines and work in a changing environment.
  • Ability to work autonomously and collaboratively.

Media and Communications Advisor, Alcohol Policy (PREV.173)

Company Name Cancer Council Victoria Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 26 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Partner with key stakeholders to drive powerful cancer prevention messaging
  • Stretch yourself to deliver complex and challenging advocacy campaigns
  • Part time (0.53 FTE) fixed term position for 12 months – St Kilda Road, Melbourne
    • About Your Environment

    Cancer Council Victoria (Cancer Council) is an independent charity that has been leading the fight against cancer since 1936. The Prevention Division aims to prevent cancer for all Victorians through community interventions, mass media, advocacy, training and providing policy advice based on the best available evidence. This involves action to affect individual behaviours and the broader physical and legislative environment to reduce cancer risk. We prioritise health inequalities, especially in relation to Aboriginal people, and in culturally diverse and socio-economically disadvantaged communities.

    This is achieved through the delivery of public health programs relating to tobacco control (Quit Victoria), obesity prevention (LiveLighter, Obesity Policy Coalition, Rethink Sugary Drink), sun protection (SunSmart), cancer screening (bowel, breast and cervical), immunisation, (HPV, hepatitis B) alcohol and organisational change (Achievement Program).

    About Your Opportunity

    We are seeking a highly motivated Media and Communications Adviser to join the Prevention Division’s Media and Communications team. Reporting to the Media and Communications Adviser – Healthy Lifestyles, your role is to:
    • Drive successful planning, implementation and evaluation of media advocacy strategies for Alcohol Policy programs
    • Identify and respond strategically to proactive and reactive media and communications opportunities around topical issues for both Cancer Council Victoria’s Alcohol Policy team and the Alcohol Policy Coalition.
    • Collaborate with spokespeople and diverse stakeholders across the areas of health, law, policy, government and research to draw attention to this high-profile issue
    • Utilise your strategic communication skills to provide advice to senior staff to ensure activities are effectively implemented.
    All About You

    We are looking for someone with:
    • A tertiary degree in communications, public relations or another relevant discipline and substantial experience in planning and implementing integrated multi-faceted media and communication strategies / campaigns
    • Proven ability to develop and implement strategic and sensitive communication plans that address proactive and reactive media opportunities
    • Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present information simply and clearly to a range of audiences.
    • Exceptional ability to build and maintain relationships as well as negotiate effectively with a wide range of individuals, organisations and communities.
    • Developed understanding of health and/ or alcohol policy would be an advantage
    What we can offer you

    This part time (0.53 FTE) fixed term position for 12 months provides a salary within range $68,616 – $77,148 pa ($36,400 – $40,900 pro rata) plus superannuation, annual leave loading and the benefits of not-for-profit salary packaging and a meal entertainment card. We also offer a flexible and friendly work environment, social and wellbeing activities and a location close to public transport.

Strategy Lead

Company Name Scentre Group (Owner and Operator of Westfield in Aus and NZ) Company Location Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 14 hours ago Number of views 47 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Join our newly created team, partnering with the Executive team to define and deliver on Scentre Group’s ambitious growth agenda
  • Opportunity to make a visible difference, designing and leading high impact strategic initiatives across the Scentre Group
  • Build and lead a high performing team in a highly visible and influential role\xa0that has a high level of influence and visibility across the group


Our Story


Scentre Group owns and operates Westfield centres in Australia and New Zealand. Our purpose is to create extraordinary places, connecting and enriching communities.


We partner with the world’s leading retail and luxury brands, home-grown entrepreneurs and local game-changers, redefining the retail, hospitality, leisure and lifestyle experiences for over 530 million customers we welcome through our doors every year. Our Westfield living centres are much more than places where people shop - we're curating the best retail, dining, entertainment and leisure experiences.


Our Strategy and Business Development team is a newly formed team, developed to partner with our executive team to reimagine and define a new corporate strategy to accelerate the Scentre Group’s growth agenda. In today’s ever-changing dynamic environment strategy across all teams must continually evolve to ensure we continue to create extraordinary experiences for our customers.


Your opportunity


As the Strategy Lead, you will report directly into the General Manager, Strategy and Business Development. Your role is responsible for directly influencing the overall Group Strategy with specific responsibility for designing and leading unique high value and high impact strategic initiatives with teams across the group including Retail and Leasing Solutions, Design and Construction and Customer Experience.


Your role and responsibilities will include, but not limited to


  • Design and manage the Group’s strategic visioning, planning and reporting process
  • Lead the scoping, prioritisation, development and execution of key strategic project
  • Partner with Senior Executives to help design and implement new strategic approaches and ideas to grow the business
  • Partner with the Business Development team to identify and design new growth initiatives
  • Recruit, lead and develop the newly formed Strategy team

What will set you apart from the rest?


We’re looking for a highly experienced senior strategy professional with a growth mindset, someone with the proven ability to reimagine existing paradigms to identify new strategic opportunities. You will have experience developing and executing corporate, commercial and operational strategies along with experience building, leading and developing high performing teams. You’ll be a structured and lateral thinker with the capability to quickly understand and apply new concepts across a large business.


  • Strong experience working within Strategy roles and ideally have experience within a top tier consulting firm
  • Degree qualified ideally with a post-graduate qualification such as an MBA
  • Retail, Property, Retail REIT or consumer products experience would be advantageous however not essential
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong stakeholder management skills


What sets us apart from the rest?


Scentre Group has a track record of incubating top talent and fast-tracking them into pivotal roles across the business.


  • Diverse career paths across our vertically integrated business
  • Ability to innovate in a company that not only encourages it but will proactively facilitate it
  • Competitive Benefits including 18 weeks parental leave, volunteer Days to work with our Charity Partners, Health and Wellbeing discounts and ability to purchase extra annual leave


We encourage and support our employees to find balance in their work lives and what is important to them outside of work by embracing a flexible approach to how they work. If you're able to perform the requirements of the role and need some form of flexibility to do so, we're open to your application and ideas on how we could make it work.


Join the Scentre Group community and see the fruits of your labour come to life.


If this sounds like you, apply today! Should you have any questions, or want to discuss the role further, please reach out to Kristy Araipu, HR Manager - Talent, on 02 9028 8143.

Job description

  • LEAD IT PROGRAM TEAMS
  • ESTABLISH EFFECTIVE SOLUTION DEVELOPMENT METHODS
  • PLAN END-TO-END DELIVERY


The Department of Planning, Transport and Infrastructure (DPTI), working closely with the State Planning Commission and the Minister for Planning are leading the delivery of a new planning system over the next 2 years. DPTI are already a year into delivery of the $25.8M commitment to deliver the State’s new planning system. The new system includes 10 new instruments or tools that will be enabled through an e-planning platform. The ambitions of the system to have a single entry e-planning portal for all development applications, land enquiries and the housing of all zoning rules has not been attempted in Australia previously.
\xa0
Working collaboratively with the Customer & Information Services management team, the IT Program Manager e-Planning\xa0is responsible for the management and delivery of a complex design, development, implementation and support of the e-Planning system. Reporting to the Program Director, you will be responsible for ensuring the IT Program is continuously aligned with all work-streams within the Reform Program. You will ensure the project and operational delivery is delivered within scope, funding and time frames through \xa0managing a team of project and operations staff, while overseeing the IT project management practices and service delivery. The key to success is ensuring an effective transition of the e-Planning system from project through to operational delivery.
\xa0
With a formal qualification and a demonstrated track record of leading large complex technology implementations, you will have experience utilising modern agile solution development techniques, with experience working with land use/planning or local government applications. You will be recognised for your ability to influence and be decisive in a complex environment with multiple technical and non-technical stakeholders. Along with your superior problem solving skills that allow you to critically assess and recommend various solutions to resolve technical issues, you will have a track record of successfully delivering IT projects on time, on budget and exceeding expectations. \xa0
\xa0
This is an exciting opportunity to design and develop end-to-end plans to ensure effective transition of the e-Planning System from project through to operational delivery by 2020.


saplanningportal.sa.gov.au

Software Engineer - Java

Company Name SiteMinder Company Location Sydney, AU

New Posted Date Posted 16 hours ago Number of views 41 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At SiteMinder we do things differently. We attribute our success to not just hiring the best people but also to ensuring our people enjoy doing what we do, in a nurturing and supportive environment. We know we don’t have all of the answers, and we’re ok with that. We want our people to be a part of helping us find those answers and navigate through the world of growth, evolution and organisational maturity. Success in SiteMinder will be defined by your ability to bridge the gap. This is between conceptualising and having the ideas, architecting and designing your ideas and then executing on them and generating the outcome in an environment where ownership and “take the bull by the horns” mentality is encouraged.

We are an energetic, fast-moving tech company that has managed to retain our start up heart and sense of humour while taking over our industry as the partners of choice for over 30,000 hoteliers worldwide. Backed by the same investors at Facebook, Netflix and Spotify, we’re an Australian software company with market leading products that support hotels to manage and maximise their online presence. Headquartered in the Rocks in Sydney, we also have offices in Bangkok, London, Dallas, and Galway.

We’re looking for Software Engineers who love all things Java but whose thirst for learning, has helped them gain experience across multiple technologies. We have our tech stack of course, but we are engineers and problem-solvers by nature who are not bound by any anything and so whatever tech will get the job done best, we will explore! We're in the middle of a radical transformation to build a 100% API-driven, containerised platform and we are looking for people like you to help us on the journey. Open to speaking to all levels from Junior to Senior.

All About You
  • Great skills in Java, Kotlin and JVM technologies, in general, to help us build backend solutions that ignite the engine.
  • Love and thrive in a fast-paced, agile and environment
  • Have a get-things-done attitude!
  • You’re proud of what you build and love simplicity and code that just works
  • Experience with or want to learn key/value store databases, for example, DynamoDB, Cassandra, MongoDB and Redis
  • Understand code testability, build pipelines, docker and CI/CD systems
Nice to have
  • AWS experience across the following: EC2, Kinesis, SQS, Elasticache, Lambda, S3
  • Know how to structure, develop and maintain relational databases (MySQL/PostGres/Oracle)
  • Exposure to the hotel tech or hospitality industry
Engineering is a core part of who we are and designing high quality software that is simple, efficient and testable is what we do. Every year our systems process tens of millions of reservations with a truly global scale, growing stronger year on year. Collaboratively work on and contribute to the construction of the component library and design system used by all of SiteMinder’s products. Keep up with best practices, latest technologies and programming languages / frameworks as needed

Do we sound worthy? If the above sounds like you, in return, you will be joining an evolving, forward thinking and progressive team hell bent on nothing but being the best. If you want challenges, ownership, accountability and a place where growth both personally and organisationally are inevitable click apply!

We're well aware that this is quite a wish-list of skills therefore if you believe you have a great blend of at least some of the above we’d love to hear from you.

911629639:
[

Equities Analyst

Company Name Morningstar Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 34 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At Morningstar great people are our most important asset and essential to our success. We seek a wide range of experiences and perspectives in individuals for our team. Our differences are our strength; the fact that we don’t all think the same way and encourage unique perspectives helps create great products and services for our clients.


The Group:\xa0Morningstar is one of the largest independent sources of fund, equity, and credit data and research in the world, and our advocacy for investors’ interests is the foundation of our company. We believe that our research analysts are among the most respected thought leaders in the industry, and we offer original, influential, thought provoking, and independent analysis. We offer intellectually challenging career paths and the opportunity to work alongside highly motivated individuals and industry experts.

\xa0

The Role:\xa0Our Equity Research team requires an equity analyst to cover Australian healthcare stocks. The role offers considerable intellectual freedom to focus on developing long-term oriented, original, and in-depth insights on complex industry issues with an emphasis on understanding ever-changing competitive dynamics. The analyst will publish detailed research pieces that exemplify our reputation for thought leadership, our ability to assess outcomes for debatable investor topics, and provide the analysis our clients need to make better investing decisions. This position is based in our Sydney office.


Key Responsibilities

  • Analyse publicly available information, earnings reports, alongside internally-generated data to create investment mosaic. Estimate fair values for about 20 companies, mostly focusing on healthcare firms.
  • Gather and analyse industry data to develop a long-term industry vision, and write notes for a sophisticated and demanding client base. Analyse implications of fundamental industry developments for coverage.
  • Regularly publish reports, detailed discounted cash flow models that focus on the key drivers of the business, and in-depth research pieces, including the qualitative and quantitative analyses of your coverage’s Economic Moats.
  • Develop relationships with coverage companies and industry participants by attending company events and industry conferences to enhance research and build brand.
  • Become an expert in Morningstar’s Economic Moat research methodology.
  • Proactively surface attractive investment ideas internally and externally to support all products and clients.
  • Act with independence and an ‘investors first’ attitude at all times.
  • Perform additional duties and responsibilities as needed from time to time.


Desired Qualifications

  • A Bachelor’s degree; a CFA designation and/or MBA or a Masters is preferred.
  • Three to five years of experience in sell side or buy side equity research; alternatively, three to five years of industry experience combined with a proven interest in equity research.
  • A bright, motivated individual with the desire to succeed in an intellectually-intense environment. Intellectual curiosity, a passion for creative analysis, and attention to detail.
  • The ability to think broadly and creatively about a range of strategic issues affecting a business.
  • Strong qualitative and quantitative acumen combined with strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to make decisions under tight deadlines, at times with incomplete information.
  • Possess independence, critical thinking skills, and a passion for investing, with a bias toward long-term fundamental research.
  • Sound financial modelling skills and knowledge of discounted cash flow modelling techniques. Advanced Excel proficiency is expected.
  • The ability to work well within a team and be capable of respectfully accepting and providing constructive feedback.


Your application package should include your CV, a cover letter, and it is preferred to include a work, school, or personal report or presentation that illustrates an equity investing decision or recommendation that you have made. Note that a writing test and/or stock pitch may be part of the interview process.

Morningstar is an equal opportunity employer.

Candidates from recruitment agencies will not be considered for this role.

A car is beneficial but the location is within walking distance of the Railway station.

Have previously worked with many backpackers who have enjoyed it.
Other Labouring work may also be available as people needed.

[

Commercial Advice Lawyer 2 years +PAE

Company Name Coleman Greig Lawyers Company Location Level 11, 100 George Street, Parramatta, NSW 2150, AU

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 6 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • \xa0Western Sydney’s Leading Law Firm
  • Opportunity for Growth
  • Work/life balance without the City commute

\xa0

Western Sydney is the engine room of the NSW Economy - fuelled by both major private and government investment - and it is booming! \xa0 \xa0So is its largest and most successful commercial law firm, Coleman Greig.


With established offices in Parramatta and Norwest, and Penrith, we are Western Sydney's leading law firm. Further expansion will also take place across the region as the highly anticipated opening of Western Sydney Airport approaches.


Celebrating 90 years in the geographic centre of Sydney, Coleman Greig prides itself on being an innovative and socially responsible firm that is an active contributor to the region's community. With a key focus on people, we pride ourselves on creating and giving our staff genuine opportunities and a better work/life balance. We offer a great client base, strong referral networks and professional support in building your practice while developing a strong personal brand.


If you are a Commercial Advice Lawyer (2 years+ PAE), with aspirations to develop a challenging and rewarding career without the city commute, Coleman Greig would like to hear from you.


Working closely with our Commercial Advice Principal and Senior Solicitors, the ideal candidate will be dealing with a wide range of issues including providing advice in relation to the Corporations Act, acquisitions and disposal of businesses, structuring of businesses, the setting up of entities for business ventures, franchising, distribution and supply agreements.


Applicants will be commercially minded, have solid communication and drafting skills; a proven team approach; demonstrated ability to think outside the square; as well as the ability to build and maintain strong client relationships.

\xa0

In return you will receive structured development opportunities, a clear career path, competitive remuneration, a fun and challenging work environment as well as the rewards of being employed by a recognised leader in Western Sydney.


If you think you are ready to reach new heights with the leading law firm in Western Sydney please forward your application to:


recruitment@colemangreig.com.au

Contact the job poster

Warrick McLean

CEO Coleman Greig Lawyers | Non Executive Director | Business Transformation | Change Management | Professional Services

Parramatta, New South Wales, Australia

912854278:
[

Senior Professional Services Engineer

Company Name MobileIron Company Location Canberra, AU

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 2 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

MobileIron is on the cutting edge of the mobile revolution. Think about how important your phone is, mobile devices are more widespread and used than PCs ever were. Companies are now struggling to keep those devices secure and able to access company information, and they are turning to Enterprise Mobility Management software to assist. MobileIron is the #1 company in the space. We were recently voted one of the best places to work by Glassdoor and ranked #1 by Deloitte as the fastest growing tech company in the past 5 years. We are looking for people that can help us build the next chapter of MobileIron which means helping us scale to meet the needs of our rapidly growing customer base. If you have a passion for Mobile IT security and management and want to join the Professional Services organization and work with very talented people , this might be the right position for you.

What You’ll Be Doing…
  • Installation and configuration of MobileIron’s EMM solution in a variety of customer environments
  • Consultative, strategic client / partner engagement to support the realization of mobility-based initiatives
  • Understand customer’s operational requirements and their technical/network architecture and EMM goals
  • Design, develop, and support the architecting of the client's production EMM environment
  • Determine the best technical approach for clients, using sound, design based, security-minded implementation principles
  • Develop the project planning guidance and project management tools to augment the day-to-day execution of client projects
  • Support small and large size customers and partners-in-industry with their EMM delivery & implementation efforts
  • Support client-based training, knowledge management, and internal learning initiatives concentric to MobileIron product support
  • Assist in the creation of deployment best practices guidance and client-centric technical content focused on enhancing client self-sustainability
  • Assist in working as a Customer Advocate, helping manage customers day to day issues, bridging the gap between various technical functions
  • Grow to a subject matter expert in custom deployed solutions and teach and mentor the rest of the team.


Who You Are…
  • Highly focused, with great attention to detail; self-motivated and capable of operating with significant autonomy
  • Experience working directly with customers in pre and post-sales, project management, and technical delivery roles
  • Possess a strong networking background with ability to troubleshoot and isolate issues with DNS, IP routing, Firewall, VPN and other network related security concepts.
  • Experience and strong hands-on skills working with Kerberos, PKI, SSL, certificate management, and general cryptographic principles
  • Understanding of essential enterprise services / components (Microsoft Exchange, LDAP, ActiveSync, etc.)
  • Capable of comprehensive project management activities, and load-balancing across multiple simultaneous projects at once
  • Ability to configure, manage and troubleshoot in complex IT environments (Virtual machines, load balancers, clustered environments, secure / air-gapped networks, etc.)
  • Understanding the Mobility landscape and maintain a significant knowledge-base concentric to mainstream mobility platforms
  • Possess experience supporting custom ROM, Samsung KNOX, Apple DEP, or Apple Configurator managed mobility efforts
  • The ability to travel up to 50% of the time.
  • Capable of undergo and successfully pass a screening test for unlawful drug and alcohol use.


What You’ve Done…
  • 7+ years’ experience in consulting, professional services, implementation, or support with a major firm (ex. Boeing, Booz Allen, Deloitte, PwC, etc.)
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills (presentation, verbal, and written); capable of briefing OCIO/OCTO level staff on a regular basis
  • Must be an Australian Citizen to be considered with current Based Security Clearance, NV1 (or higher); Australian Government security clearance will be highly regarded
  • Experience with articulating and implementing complex, client-driven technical concepts
  • Demonstrated self-motivation and good business acumen, with a proven track record of successful client delivery
  • Functioned in a highly independent / autonomous manner; working remotely on behalf of the organization and interfacing with key clients regularly
  • Successfully managed >10 high-visibility, technical implementation projects at once
  • Established key client relationships organically through high-quality service delivery
  • Experience working in a fast paced startup environment is a plus
  • Demonstrated strong troubleshooting and reasoning skills
  • Experience working directly with customers in technical delivery roles, additional pre- and post-sales or project management is a plus
  • BS in Computer Science or related technical field preferred or equivalent experience
  • We are an EEO/AA Employer. Protected veterans and individuals with disability encouraged to apply.

Sales Engineer

Company Name The Couta Group Pty Ltd Company Location Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 3 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Couta Group imports and wholesales a range of innovative plumbing products including gas, water, heating and chilling piping products. Our brands are available through plumbing merchants around Australia and include Gas Pex, Water Pex and Heat Pex.

With the continued expansion of the company, we are seeking to add an enthusiastic young engineer to New South Wales sales team. This position is available immediately and will suit a motivated individual who is looking to establish or develop their professional sales career. Some travel will likely be required as a part of the role. \xa0

\xa0
The purpose of the role is to create and maintain relationships with new and existing customers and generate sales by fulfilling customer needs. The successful candidate will most likely have the following qualities:

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 An engineering, plumbing or technical background that helps them to best understand the products that we sell

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Positive enthusiasm for everything they do - Loves to win

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Easily forms relationships with others and has a genuine desire to help people

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Honest and ethical coupled with street smarts

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Excellent problem solving skills and attention to detail

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Computer literate and good verbal and written communication skills

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Accepts personal responsibility for delivering expected results

The successful applicant will enjoy the following benefits:

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Be part of a team that genuinely gets on well

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Regular support and training opportunities

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Attractive salary package that includes a fully maintained company vehicle, lap top, phone and bonus scheme

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Opportunity to participate in the Company’s Employee Share Scheme

If this sounds like the perfect role for you, please email hr@coutagroup.com.au.
